channel.title: INtopBackup
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtopBackup, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: New malaria drug could be a life-saver as the standard drug shows signs of weakness
item.description: The best drug to fight malaria is facing increased resistance from the parasites it fights. Now there's an alternative in the pipeline and it looks pr...

item.title: Who is Laura Loomer, President Trump's self-described chief 'loyalty enforcer'?
item.description: The New Yorker's Antonia Hitchens describes how Loomer went from a conspiracy theorist to a close ally of Trump who's gotten government officials she ...

item.title: Israel's president says 'shocking' settler violence against Palestinians must end
item.description: Israeli President Isaac Herzog added a rare and powerful voice to what has been muted criticism by top Israeli officials of Israeli settler violence a...

item.title: Greetings from the Arctic Circle, where an icebreaker ship drew polar bears' attention
item.description: Far-Flung Postcards is a weekly series in which NPR's international team shares moments from their lives and work around the world.

item.title: The chess federation accuses a former champion of harassing a rival who died
item.description: The game's governing body has filed a complaint against Vladimir Kramnik. Other players say he spent months making unproven allegations of cheating ag...

item.title: 10/8: The Takeout with Major Garrett
item.description: Former FBI Director James Comey pleads not guilty as a trial date is set for Jan. 5; New book looks at the threat of the anti-science movement.

item.title: French relief as Algeria frees jailed novelist at centre of diplomatic crisis
item.description: Almost a year to the day after Boualem Sansal was arrested, the Algerian president grants him a pardon.

item.title: Chicagoans buy out street vendors amid a federal immigration crackdown
Trump urges Israel's president to pardon Benjamin Netanyahu
item.description: President Herzog's office says he holds Trump "in the highest regard", but that anyone seeking a pardon has to submit a formal request.

item.title: SNAP benefits to resume quickly once government shutdown ends, experts say
item.description: A government funding package could soon reopen federal agencies, opening the door for food-stamp recipients to collect their full benefits.

item.title: House debates funding bill ahead of final vote to end shutdown
item.description: The House is in session to debate a funding package that will end the longest government shutdown in U.S. history. Follow live updates here.

item.title: Appeals court weighs arguments on law cutting Medicaid funds to Planned Parenthood
Ex-aide to California governor indicted for alleged theft of campaign funds from ex-health secretary
item.description: A former top aide to California Gov. Gavin Newsom has been indicted on federal charges alleging her involvement in a scheme to steal campaign money fr...

item.title: Democrat Adelita Grijalva sworn in 7 weeks after winning House election
item.description: Democrat Adelita Grijalva was sworn in as a member of Congress on Wednesday afternoon, seven weeks after she won a special election in Arizona.

item.title: At least 37 killed in Peru after bus plunges into ravine
item.description: The bus was carrying 60 passengers when it collided with a truck and careered off the road in the Arequipa region.

item.title: Amazon sued over allegedly punitive workplace absence practices
item.description: A class action lawsuit filed in a New York federal court on Wednesday claims Amazon uses a "punitive absence control system" against its employees.

item.title: Italy investigates claim that tourists paid to go to Bosnia to kill besieged civilians
item.description: Italians and others are alleged to have paid large sums to fire at Bosnians risking their lives in besieged Sarajevo.

item.title: Delhi blast was terror incident, Indian government says
item.description: India's government says it unequivocally condemns the "dastardly and cowardly act" that killed eight people.
